school_name: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
tag_professor: Gives good feedback (10)  Respected (6)  LOTS OF HOMEWORK (6)  Clear grading criteria (3)  Participation matters (3)  SO MANY PAPERS (3)  Tough Grader (2)  Caring (2)  Inspirational (2)  Amazing lectures (1)  Get ready to read (1)  Hilarious (1)
stu_tags: SO MANY PAPERS  GIVES GOOD FEEDBACK  RESPECTED
comments: Harder than most 105 classes, but is worth it because my writing improved greatly. He gives great feedback on papers and isn\'t a tough grader. But you won\'t do well if you don\'t listen to his feedback. There is homework daily, but he can also be very understanding if you find yourself having a difficult time. Good man to know. 100% worthwhile!

school_name: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
tag_professor: Gives good feedback (10)  Respected (6)  LOTS OF HOMEWORK (6)  Clear grading criteria (3)  Participation matters (3)  SO MANY PAPERS (3)  Tough Grader (2)  Caring (2)  Inspirational (2)  Amazing lectures (1)  Get ready to read (1)  Hilarious (1)
comments: I respect this guy, but this class was kind of weird. He gave great feedback (so much that if you just read the comments and didn\'t look at your grade you would think you bombed an essay when in reality you did well). He didn\'t grade too harshly. However, I never got anything out of actually attending class, but participation is part of the grade.

school_name: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
tag_professor: Gives good feedback (10)  Respected (6)  LOTS OF HOMEWORK (6)  Clear grading criteria (3)  Participation matters (3)  SO MANY PAPERS (3)  Tough Grader (2)  Caring (2)  Inspirational (2)  Amazing lectures (1)  Get ready to read (1)  Hilarious (1)
comments: Henry is the best professor I have had at UNC! I have now taken him for both ENGL 105 and 137. He truly does make you a better writer. He gives lots of feedback, but does not grade harshly. I 100% recommend taking his classes.

school_name: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
tag_professor: Gives good feedback (10)  Respected (6)  LOTS OF HOMEWORK (6)  Clear grading criteria (3)  Participation matters (3)  SO MANY PAPERS (3)  Tough Grader (2)  Caring (2)  Inspirational (2)  Amazing lectures (1)  Get ready to read (1)  Hilarious (1)
stu_tags: GIVES GOOD FEEDBACK  TOUGH GRADER  CLEAR GRADING CRITERIA
comments: Henry was definitely a harder Engl105 professor than most, but he made me a better writer and student. I\'m happy I took English 105 with him has he prepared me for future classes at UNC.

school_name: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
tag_professor: Gives good feedback (10)  Respected (6)  LOTS OF HOMEWORK (6)  Clear grading criteria (3)  Participation matters (3)  SO MANY PAPERS (3)  Tough Grader (2)  Caring (2)  Inspirational (2)  Amazing lectures (1)  Get ready to read (1)  Hilarious (1)
stu_tags: LOTS OF HOMEWORK  CLEAR GRADING CRITERIA  GIVES GOOD FEEDBACK
comments: Henry is a great professor. He assigns homework almost always daily, but that means there are more chances for you to get your grade up, learn and do your best. He will change his lecture according to the students\' feedback and what is best for their learning style, etc. He has a rubric for what he expects and he\'s straightforward.

school_name: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
tag_professor: Gives good feedback (10)  Respected (6)  LOTS OF HOMEWORK (6)  Clear grading criteria (3)  Participation matters (3)  SO MANY PAPERS (3)  Tough Grader (2)  Caring (2)  Inspirational (2)  Amazing lectures (1)  Get ready to read (1)  Hilarious (1)
stu_tags: SO MANY PAPERS  TOUGH GRADER  LOTS OF HOMEWORK
comments: Henry is a very smart guy but is full of himself because he just got published. He goes on tangents for entire class periods and then assigns nightly homework (uncommon for ENGL 105). Compared to any of y friends who took 105, his class is absurdly harder. Also set a due date for 5pm on the Sat over Easter break for an assignment worth 5% of grade.

school_name: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
tag_professor: Gives good feedback (10)  Respected (6)  LOTS OF HOMEWORK (6)  Clear grading criteria (3)  Participation matters (3)  SO MANY PAPERS (3)  Tough Grader (2)  Caring (2)  Inspirational (2)  Amazing lectures (1)  Get ready to read (1)  Hilarious (1)
stu_tags: LOTS OF HOMEWORK  SO MANY PAPERS
comments: Veggian assigns an absurd amount of work for English 105. Everyone else I\'ve talked to who has taken the class said they just watched movies or wrote a couple papers. Veggian spends class rambling about mostly nothing and assigns homework every night and a ridiculous amount of papers to write.

school_name: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
tag_professor: Gives good feedback (10)  Respected (6)  LOTS OF HOMEWORK (6)  Clear grading criteria (3)  Participation matters (3)  SO MANY PAPERS (3)  Tough Grader (2)  Caring (2)  Inspirational (2)  Amazing lectures (1)  Get ready to read (1)  Hilarious (1)
stu_tags: RESPECTED  GIVES GOOD FEEDBACK  CLEAR GRADING CRITERIA
comments: I honestly didn\'t like this class because it was paper heavy. After all, it\'s an english class, but I respect Henry as a professor. He\'s a smart man who loves to talk. I wouldn\'t say I learned much about writing that I didn\'t already know, but Henry makes sure you have the foundations of writing. He grades relatively easy and gives clear feedback.

school_name: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
tag_professor: Gives good feedback (10)  Respected (6)  LOTS OF HOMEWORK (6)  Clear grading criteria (3)  Participation matters (3)  SO MANY PAPERS (3)  Tough Grader (2)  Caring (2)  Inspirational (2)  Amazing lectures (1)  Get ready to read (1)  Hilarious (1)
comments: Henry is the ideal professor to take ENGL 105 with. He gives good feedback on your papers and takes mercy on your grade if you do poorly on a paper. Henry is a very smart man and knows a plethora of different subjects outside of English and always ties them in with his lectures. Take ENGL 105 with Henry. He\'ll prepare you for writing at UNC.

school_name: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
tag_professor: Gives good feedback (10)  Respected (6)  LOTS OF HOMEWORK (6)  Clear grading criteria (3)  Participation matters (3)  SO MANY PAPERS (3)  Tough Grader (2)  Caring (2)  Inspirational (2)  Amazing lectures (1)  Get ready to read (1)  Hilarious (1)
stu_tags: AMAZING LECTURES  PARTICIPATION MATTERS  GET READY TO READ
comments: Henry is a great professor and is really thought provoking. However, he thrives on making his students uncomfortable because it makes us think more. It just depends on your personality, if you can handle this or not.

school_name: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
tag_professor: Gives good feedback (10)  Respected (6)  LOTS OF HOMEWORK (6)  Clear grading criteria (3)  Participation matters (3)  SO MANY PAPERS (3)  Tough Grader (2)  Caring (2)  Inspirational (2)  Amazing lectures (1)  Get ready to read (1)  Hilarious (1)
comments: I\'ve had Henry for both ENGL137 and ENGL105. He is one of my favorite professors at UNC. He is very knowledgable and definitely a unique professor. He is always there for his students and helped me develop a higher level writing style. He often goes on tangents, but they are always very interesting. I highly recommend taking his 105 and ENGL137.

school_name: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
tag_professor: Gives good feedback (10)  Respected (6)  LOTS OF HOMEWORK (6)  Clear grading criteria (3)  Participation matters (3)  SO MANY PAPERS (3)  Tough Grader (2)  Caring (2)  Inspirational (2)  Amazing lectures (1)  Get ready to read (1)  Hilarious (1)
comments: Henry is very unconventional. The class is all discussion based and he usually lets the students determine what exactly you will be talking about. No tests and the reading is really unnecessary. He\'s a cool guy and as long as you participate and he can see that you\'re trying you will get a good grade.

school_name: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
tag_professor: Gives good feedback (10)  Respected (6)  LOTS OF HOMEWORK (6)  Clear grading criteria (3)  Participation matters (3)  SO MANY PAPERS (3)  Tough Grader (2)  Caring (2)  Inspirational (2)  Amazing lectures (1)  Get ready to read (1)  Hilarious (1)
comments: Henry is great and really smart. He always tells you exactly what to do and lets you revise stuff a million times before you hand it in. I actually learned a lot in his class, even though I am not a huge fan of writing papers. Sometimes, he goes off on tangents but I always find his stories interesting and fun. Wouldn\'t mind having him again.

comments: He\'s a great professor! He gives a lot of busy work in the beginning, though. He requires you to post intermediate steps in writing paper, which can be annoying, but it stopped me from procrastinating. He grades pretty easy, and I think he is looking for improvement.

school_name: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
tag_professor: Gives good feedback (10)  Respected (6)  LOTS OF HOMEWORK (6)  Clear grading criteria (3)  Participation matters (3)  SO MANY PAPERS (3)  Tough Grader (2)  Caring (2)  Inspirational (2)  Amazing lectures (1)  Get ready to read (1)  Hilarious (1)
comments: Fabulous Professor! Although most of the time he lectured on other things that didn\'t pertain to English, he was very interesting to listen to and is very intelligent. If you show an effort, you will do well in the class. It is possible to get a high grade in his class. You do have to buy the textbook however because you use it a good amount.

school_name: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill

comments: FABULOUS PROFESSOR. I loved his class. The material wasn\'t easy but his attitude and teaching skills make it an easy A. He\'s wonderful. 1010 definitely recommend!

school_name: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
tag_professor: Gives good feedback (10)  Respected (6)  LOTS OF HOMEWORK (6)  Clear grading criteria (3)  Participation matters (3)  SO MANY PAPERS (3)  Tough Grader (2)  Caring (2)  Inspirational (2)  Amazing lectures (1)  Get ready to read (1)  Hilarious (1)
comments: He\'s such a chill guy, if you show up to class and write a decent paper you\'ll get an A. He grades a lot based on effort and he\'s very forgiving (I was sick for 2 weeks and he let me turn in everything later for full credit) I highly recommend taking him for 105

school_name: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
tag_professor: Gives good feedback (10)  Respected (6)  LOTS OF HOMEWORK (6)  Clear grading criteria (3)  Participation matters (3)  SO MANY PAPERS (3)  Tough Grader (2)  Caring (2)  Inspirational (2)  Amazing lectures (1)  Get ready to read (1)  Hilarious (1)
comments: This class is relatively easy, but it is still not a joke. He takes writing very seriously. A paper was due about every week. Most lectures are completely unrelated to english, but he was an interesting professor.

school_name: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
tag_professor: Gives good feedback (10)  Respected (6)  LOTS OF HOMEWORK (6)  Clear grading criteria (3)  Participation matters (3)  SO MANY PAPERS (3)  Tough Grader (2)  Caring (2)  Inspirational (2)  Amazing lectures (1)  Get ready to read (1)  Hilarious (1)
comments: Super intelligent. Although his instructions are not always clear, he is understanding and willing to help and encourages students to take chances in order to improve their writing. Very practical grader (as in he grades for grammar/technique/coherence instead of content), as well--so you don\'t have to worry if your beliefs don\'t match his.
